title: When Warwicks rework comes along, will he be an assassin, a Dive-fighter, or something else?
body:
I'd personally like him to be a Dive-fighter, and would despise a transformation into an assassin. But, whatever will be healthier for him, is what I want. I used to play him a lot top lane while I was leveling up my account, so I have a soft spot for that Wolfman.

Also, I hope you increase his mechanical skillcap, as autos and an instant teleport ult certainly doesn't offer an engaging kit. :p

replies.body:
Almost certainly still a diver. 

A bit more mechanical skill on the kit's also likely, though likely just a moderate amount - we'll be aiming to keep Warwick still heavily focused on decision versus mechanical skill relative to other champions.

Will you keep AP Warwick? Pweeeese, pleaaase, I'm done losing on so many offbuilds... every new champ either has no secondary possible playstyle by having no scalings or by having it do the same thing but worse... we used to have Tank, AP and AD Malph, AP GP, AP Kogmaw, distinct playstyles for AP and AD Malzahar... I miss all this.
They said they'll leave AP ratio on Q, so maybe Magewick will still be... Hmm, maybe not viable, because it's just a yolo build, but playable and fun.

In urf mode I have made many enemies' lives living hell. Particularly with flash + ult into 100/0 some poor squishy, or late game 1v1s where I heal 1000 damage as well as inflict the same to an enemy every 2 seconds.

I'm hoping that the ratio remains the same; it never really was an issue due to the massive mana cost and the possibility of going oom very quickly (outside of URF, duh)
I'd say viable. I've outpoked many midlaners with that.
Please, first let them make him viable

Will the Warwick rework serve as a "sneak peek" for the direction you want to go with divers in general? On the one hand, I would think so, but on the other hand Warwick's the major "tank diver" alongside Sejuani's "diving tank" and most other dive champions tend to be frailer and hit harder.

I wish for him to be a tad more agile than simply having a lot of situational MS and a flat dash.

There's this character called Yugo the Wolf from the old and now dead franchise, Bloody Roar, his most iconic move was bouncing of a wall and launching himself towards the enemy, it could be nice if Warwick had this sort of dash, it's pretty violent and unpredictable, plus who isn't afraid of a werewolf chasing you and running by jumping on walls?
true dmg % and shield added ? like most of new reworks
Happy to know my warwick is in good hands. (please dont mordekaiser him!)
